# item(withTitle:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the first menu item in the menu with a specified title.

## Declaration

```swift
func item(withTitle title: String) -> NSMenuItem?
```

## Parameters

- **title**: The title of a menu item.

## Return Value

The found menu item (an object conforming to the NSMenuItem protocol) or `nil` if the object couldn’t be found.

## Related Documentation

- **indexOfItem(withTitle:)**: Returns the index of the first menu item in the menu that has a specified title.

## Finding Menu Items

- **item(withTag:)**: Returns the first menu item in the menu with the specified tag.
- **item(at:)**: Returns the menu item at a specific location of the menu.
- **numberOfItems**: The number of menu items in the menu, including separator items.
- **items**: An array containing the menu items in the menu.
